name: Runos
body: ### Introduction “_Could an OpenFlow controller be both easy to develop applications for and also high performance?_” *Runos* is an OpenFlow Controller. It is fully userspace controller with high functionality, easy to develop your apps, relatively high performance comparing with existing controllers. It supports OpenFlow 1.3. Basic characteristics: * Performance: 8M fps (flows per second) * Latency: 55 us Current list of applications: * L2 learning switch – on each switch individually, learning mac addresses. * Topology discovery * End host monitoring -- tracking the activity and presence in the network end nodes (roaming). * L2 forwarding – building the shortest path across the network. We have a VirtualBox VM with pre-installed RUNOS (login/password - runos/runos): http://bit.ly/runos-vm-latest Slides with architecture details and roadmap are here: http://www.slideshare.net/AlexanderShalimov/runos-openflow-controller-eng The official mailing list is here http://groups.google.com/d/forum/runos-ofc.
